intro: Pavetta baconia var. hispida, commonly known as the rough pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
